title: Tiefenbrunner 2017 Pinot Grigio (Vigneti delle Dolomiti)
description: This wine's honeysuckle, hawthorn and honeydew melon aromas take center stage while the medium-bodied palate offers green apple, citrus and white peach notes. Fresh acidity brightens the fruity flavors.

title: Usiglian del Vescovo 2015  Chianti Superiore
description: This opens with dark-skinned fruit, leather and underbrush aromas. The juicy, accessible palate offers black-skinned berry, clove and tobacco notes alongside fine-grained tannins. It's all balanced with bright acidity. Enjoy through 2022.

title: Waxwing 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Rustic aromas of baked earth, red cherry sauce, dark plum and slightly burned gingerbread show on the nose of this appellation blend. It's quite dark on the palate, with deep plum and boysenberry flavors, framed by decent acidity and a firm structure. Nothing sticks out, for better and worse.

title: Zantho 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)
description: Wet pebble and green moss waft past the nose and continue on the light but very citrus-driven palate. Bright lemon accentuates the lightness even more and makes the dry finish wonderfully fresh.

title: Armida 2016 PoiZin Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This lovable hearty red includes 10% Petite Sirah, the grapes pulled from five vineyards across the appellation. Smooth, thick and concentrated, it offers graham cracker, blackberry jam and a presence of dark chocolate.

title: Auclair 2015 Right Blend Artz Vineyard Red (Red Mountain)
description: This wine is two-thirds Merlot, with the balance Cabernet Franc. The aromas bring notes of golden raisin box, cedar, anise, mineral and cherry, seeming a bit dried out. The palate offers a fine sense of structure.

title: Baldassari Family Wines 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Beautiful pink and orange in color, the nose of this wine is akin to a Creamsicle, with fresh citrus. The acidity lingers on a tart bracing finish.

title: Barefoot Bubbly NV Brut Cuvée Chardonnay (California)
description: Well balanced, dry and somewhat restrained in fruit flavors, this is a classic style of brut that will please a lot of different palates. It has tiny bubbles that persist in the glass, an elegant, crisp mouthfeel and a clean fresh finish.

title: Bogle 2015 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This full-bodied wine has spicy-sweet aromas, nicely ripe cherry and berry flavors and a fairly soft smooth texture. It's one of the best California Pinots for the money.

title: Bressia 2015 Monteagrelo Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Saucy, earthy, almost muddled aromas are not overtly fruity. A dense palate is deep and saturated but frankly a little syrupy. Concentrated berry flavors have a soupy character, while this tastes minty on the finish.

title: Campuget 2017 Tradition Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Delicate in both aroma and flavor, this pale-pink rosé offers perfumed cherry blossom and crisp red cherry and raspberry notes. While dry and full in body, it's refreshingly mineral, brightened by juicy, lemony acidity.

title: Cantagallo 2016  Chianti Montalbano
description: This opens with iris, underbrush and thyme hints. The straightforward, easy-drinking palate offers red cherry, white pepper and clove flavors alongside pliant tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Casa di Monte 2011  Chianti Montespertoli
description: This opens with earthy aromas of scorched soil, leather and dark-skinned fruit. The savory, solid palate offers black-skinned berry, tobacco and white pepper flavors alongside firm tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Castel di Pugna 2015  Chianti Superiore
description: This opens with earthy aromas of underbrush, cedar and dark-skinned fruit. The savory palate offers dried black cherry, licorice and tobacco notes alongside polished tannins. Drink through 2022.

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Warm aromas of white peach meet with blanched almonds and toast on the clean and inviting nose of this bottling. There's a strong and likable toasty quality to the palate, topped with butter and marmalade. It's rich, but not overly done, cut by a spray of lemon juice.

title: Château des Demoiselles 2017 Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Owned by the same family as Château Sainte Roseline, this estate has produced a softly fruity, lightly zesty wine. Touches of spice and pepper from the Grenache and Cinsault are lifted by plenty of acidity and red-currant fruitiness. Drink the wine now.

title: Château des Mille Anges 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: This spicy, lightly smoky wine is rich and full of fruit. A touch of pepper goes with the rich pear and apricot flavors. The wine is full in the mouth, intensely fruity and ready to drink.

title: Château du Carrubier 2017 Cuvée de Clara Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: It's possible to sense a touch of saltiness from the nearby sea in this crisp wine. Acidity and spice from the almost 100% Grenache in the wine give character, richness and a ripe aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Ferry Lacombe 2017 Mira Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: Produced from grapes grown throughout the Provence region, this soft, fruity wine with wild strawberry flavors is finely balanced with acidity. Immediately friendly and ready to drink now.

title: Château Haut-Rian 2017  Bordeaux Blanc
description: Crisp sliced-apple flavors give this wine a distinctive and delicious character. It has a touch of spice along with plenty of acidity, giving a ripe wine that has a good burst of freshness at the end. Drink now.

title: Château Husson 2015 Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: Juicy, forward black cherry and berry flavors abound in this approachable, easy-drinking blend of Grenache and Syrah. It's full bodied and plump in texture but edged neatly by fine, taut tannins. Drink now–2020.

title: Château Peyrassol 2017 Cuvée de la Commanderie Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Named for the ancient castle that stood on this site, this wine is open, ripe and fruity. It has a mineral edge from the limestone in the soil and from the crisp red fruits. It's a bright, ready-to-drink wine, great for the summer.

title: Château Sainte Roseline 2017 Lampe de Méduse Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: In its oil-lamp-shaped bottle, this is the entry-level wine at this estate. It is fruity and immediately delicious, packed with fruitiness, refreshing and with a bright aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Château Val Joanis 2017 Tradition Estate Bottled Rosé (Luberon)
description: Delicate peach and strawberry flavors are offset by bramble and crushed stone notes in this plump but vibrantly balanced dry rosé. It's a crisply concentrated, refreshing wine to enjoy now.

title: Chloe 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Baked cherry, boysenberry, violet and baking spice show on the nose of this widely available bottling. Clean crisp flavors of red currant are tart, tightly wound and zippy.

title: Domaine d'Astros 2017 Cuvée Prestige Rosé (Maures)
description: Made by the estate's seventh generation of the Maurel family, this wine is light, bright with delicious raspberry and bitter-orange flavors. It is crisp, packed with fruit and ready to drink.

title: Domaine de la Piégonne 2017 Rosé (Ventoux)
description: More mineral than fruity, this vivacious, dry rosé offers understated raspberry and wild strawberry notes anchored by firm strikes of crushed stone and chalk. It's full bodied but briskly composed, with a pristine finish.

title: Domaine la Millière 2016 Vieilles Vignes Red (Côtes du Rhône)
description: This fresh and fragrant wine offers loads of juicy blackberry and mulberry flavors. It's approachably fruity and slightly grapey in profile but elevated by tinges of Mediterranean herb and granitic minerality. The tannins are finely textured but quite bold on the finish.

title: Domaine le Novi 2017 Côte Levant Rosé (Luberon)
description: A small proportion of Vermentino lends vibrance to this Grenache-dominated blend. Light bodied and crisp, it offers loads of tart cherry and raspberry flavor. It's an invigorating, easy-drinking dry wine that finishes brisk and clean.

title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2017 Pauline Rosé (Mediterranée)
description: Made from the Corsican grape Niellucciu (aka Sangiovese), this wine is tight and packed with acidity as well as a bite of bitter orange and citrus. Named after the winemaker's eldest daughter, it's crisp and likely to be better from late 2018.
